title: Driver arrested after 39 bodies found in truck in UK
text:
British Police forensics officers work on lorry, found to be containing 39 dead bodies | Bens Stansall/AFP via Getty Images Driver arrested after 39 bodies found in truck in UK Vehicle was registered in Bulgaria and police believe it entered the UK through Belgium.

A truck driver was arrested on suspicion of murder after the bodies of 39 people were found in a Bulgarian-registered vehicle in Essex, southern England.

Essex police said in a statement that everyone inside the truck container, 38 adults and one teenager, had died, and that a 25-year-old man from Northern Ireland had been arrested.

Originally, police said they believed the container entered the U.K. through Holyhead in Wales. But they later said the container traveled from the port of Zeebrugge in Belgium to Purfleet in Essex.

Prime Minister Boris Johnson said he was "appalled by this tragic incident."

On Wednesday afternoon, the Bulgarian ministry of foreign affairs said the truck was registered in the coastal town of Varna, the Guardian reported.

Bulgarian Prime Minister Boyko Borissov told the private television channel BTV that the truck had not re-entered the country since its registration, according to Reuters.

“The truck had been registered in 2017 in Bulgaria by an Irish woman. It then left the country and never re-entered. So there is no way that we can be connected, except from the registration plates of the truck,” he said.

This story has been updated.
description: Vehicle was registered in Bulgaria and police believe it entered the UK through Belgium.
